title: Azure Service Bus: Process related messages from a session-enabled queue for the same workflow instance - Sequential convoy pattern
description: This workflow template triggers when a message is available in a Service Bus session enabled queue. The workflow creates a new instances for each session available in the queue, processes related messages from that session in the same workflow instance, one at a time.
prerequisites: Before you can use this template, you need to set up a Service Bus namespace and create a queue with sessions enabled. For more information, see [Create a Service Bus namespace and a queue](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2296007) and [Enable message sessions for a Service Bus queue](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2296202). You also need to set up your logic app to support stateful connectors, which is required for sessions. For more information, see [Enable stateful mode for stateless built-in connectors in Azure Logic Apps](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2296010).

parameters.name: queueNameSession_#workflowname#
parameters.default: Service Bus session enabled queue name
parameters.description: The name of the session enabled Service Bus queue from where to get the message.

parameters.name: messageBatchSize_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The number of messages to get as a single batch.

parameters.name: delayInMinutes_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The number of minutes to delay processing before renewing the lock token. Make sure this value is smaller than the queue's lock token duration.
